highlights.highlight: it is one of those non-game games I mentioned; a form of entertainment that really doesn't have a winner, or even a real conclusion. And because of its unrestrained pace of action
highlights.highlight_note: Iwata está falando do Animal Crossing que seria lançado para Nintendo DS com conexão Wi-Fi. Ele se refere ao jogo como "non-game" ou "não-jogo" atribuindo características de um estilo de jogo onde não há um vencedor ou uma real conclusão.

title: A CLOSER LOOK AT JONAS BLUME’S RHYTHM ZERO LOS SANTOS | Patreon

highlights.highlight: In 1974, Marina Abramović stood immobile for six hours in a Naples gallery, inviting the public to do “whatever they wanted” to her body using a table of 72 objects including a feather, honey, bread, wine, scissors, nails, scalpel and a gun loaded with a single bullet. That performance is known as Rhythm 0.

title: THE POOR IMAGE, THE MALE GAZE, THE ORGAN-WITHOUT-BODY: READING MIRANDA’S UNDERW[H]E(A)RE | Patreon

highlights.highlight: Luca Miranda’s Underw[h]e(a)re is a critical intervention into the polished, seemingly immersive environment of Assassin’s Creed: Unity (2014), disrupting its visual coherence by redirecting the camera toward the game’s underclass of background characters denied narrative agency.

Developed in 2020, Underw[h]e(a)re comprises one hundred high-resolution images from Assassin’s Creed: Unity (2014) alongside an 8-minute 33-second machinima. Initially conceived as an in-game photography series, it captures female non-player characters from a low, intrusive angle clearly mimicking the genre of upskirt photography, documenting recurring patterns in virtual costuming throughout a simulated eighteenth-century Paris.

Additionally, as the project page demonstrates, this forensic gaze recalls early online pornographic image archives, acting as a counter-database that reveals the procedural homogeneity of gender in contemporary game worlds.
Miranda’s intervention clearly intersects with Laura Mulvey’s concept of the male gaze, demonstrating how the game fetishises a narrow female body type even in its unseen details.

Video Games are a medium often used as escapism, to live vicariously through others or live out a life they wish they had. But what if it was more than just that? What if it made you question yourÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂ¢ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¬ÃÂÃÂÃÂÃÂ¦

Video Games are a medium often used as escapism, to live vicariously through others or live out a life they wish they had. But what if it was more than just that? What if it made you question your values and take a step back to consider other perspectives? That is what Cyberpunk 2077 did, it told a story not to question the world we live in but to question how you choose to view it through the actions you take, each character’s motives, and the world it is set in.
